results.content: I really love this course and it has taught me so much that I never knew about coding before, from my experiences from different coding websites, I have never felt too comfortable doing coding as I have with this course. My dad thought that it would be a great website for me since he uses this website as well and when I tried it I immediately fell in love with it. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and tell them that it teaches a lot because it does! Like I said before, it truly is very helpful and I love the teacher's method of teaching and not overwhelming the student either. Thank you so much for making this course because it helps with my career as well!

results.content: I have virtually no experience with coding of any kind. The first portion of the course was overwhelming. There was a lot of data and terminology introduced too quickly. The second portion of the course is perfect! I mean it’s really perfect for me. I would suggest redoing the first portion/overview. Edit out much of the terminology as it’s really incomprehensible for a new person. Perhaps break it up into sections on a need-to-know followed by examples and practice.
results.content_html: I have virtually no experience with coding of any kind. The first portion of the course was overwhelming. There was a lot of data and terminology introduced too quickly. The second portion of the course is perfect! I mean it’s really perfect for me. I would suggest redoing the first portion/overview. results.content: He speaks too quickly and doesn't really explain things in a real world outcome. He doesn't explain the logic. If I were a kid I'd be pretty lost. Especially the opening block where he just throws a lot of concepts but just writing it and not explaining what that would translate to, it's pretty tricky to follow along. He could also make the tutorials longer than 1 minute each so that there is a more well rounded approach to the information. It's clear he knows what he is doing though but the relay of that info could be much better.
results.content_html: He speaks too quickly and doesn't really explain things in a real world outcome. He doesn't explain the logic. If I were a kid I'd be pretty lost. Especially the opening block where he just throws a lot of concepts but just writing it and not explaining what that would translate to, it's pretty tricky to follow along. He could also make the tutorials longer than 1 minute each so that there is a more well rounded approach to the information. It's clear he knows what he is doing though but the relay of that info could be much better.

results.content: The explanations aren't particularly easy to understand, particularly the section on integers. It would be good to replace the variable name 'number' with anything else, even 'banana' to better understand variable names. The speaker is hard to follow, he speaks too fast. Also need to add pauses to tell people to pause the video and do the exercises. It doesn't flow very well right now. We are able to help the kids to understand what to do but I wouldn't be able to leave them by themselves to do this course, even though they are 9 and 11.
results.content_html: The explanations aren't particularly easy to understand, particularly the section on integers. It would be good to replace the variable name 'number' with anything else, even 'banana' to better understand variable names. The speaker is hard to follow, he speaks too fast. Also need to add pauses to tell people to pause the video and do the exercises. It doesn't flow very well right now. We are able to help the kids to understand what to do but I wouldn't be able to leave them by themselves to do this course, even though they are 9 and 11.
